info.name: Sila API v0.2 - Local Signer Server Edition
info.description:
These endpoints are designed to work with our lightweight local proxy server. The local server signs and forwards requests to the main API host.

Authentication of requests made to the main API host is performed using ETH signatures. For more information, visit our docs at https://docs.silamoney.com/docs/process-overview.

request.description:
Upload documents by posting to this endpoint, which uses a multipart/form-data content type; the "data" field contains JSON metadata.

If you are using the signer-server, you can set the "x-set-file-hash" header to "hash", and the signer-server will generate the hash for you.

If you're not using the signer-server, you will need to generate the file hash with SHA256 and include it in the request.

header.description: Forwards to this endpoint on main API host.
Sets epoch on specified JSON key. (Dots indicate nested dictionaries.)
Sets a random UUID4 string on specified JSON key.

query.description: Requests that proxy send back debug information about request and response.

Support pagination with "per_page" and "page" query parameters

The document will be the entire response body.

item.description:
This folder contains /add, /update, and /delete requests for changing a user's registered data. These endpoints are used to change data that is used in verification.

Note that some data cannot be changed after a verification has already passed or while a verification is still in progress (pending), and that only one SSN or EIN can be added to an entity at a time.

body.raw:
{
    "header": {
        "app_handle": "{{app_handle}}",
        "user_handle": "{{user_handle}}"
    },
    "search_filters": {
    "transaction_id": "{{some UUID string assigned by Sila}}",    
    "show_timelines": true,
    "sort_ascending": false,
    "max_sila_amount": "{{transaction max amount}}",
    "min_sila_amount": "{{transaction min amount}}",
    "statuses": ["queued", "pending", "failed", "success", "rollback", "review"],
    "start_epoch": "{{transaction start time}}",
    "end_epoch": "{{transaction end time}}",
    "page": 1,
    "per_page": 20,
    "transaction_types": "{{transaction type}}",
    "bank_account_name": "{{bank_account_name}}",
    "blockchain_address": "{{blockchain_address_of_the_wallet}}",
    "destination_id": "UUID of destination PaymentInstrument",
    "source_id": "UUID of source PaymentInstrument",
    "effective_date": {{effective_date of transaction}},
    "effective_epoch": {{effective_epoch of transaction}},
    "payment_method_id" : "UUID of virtual account id"
  }
}

request.description: Initiates a transaction which transfers a given amount (in Sila) from the ETH wallet used to sign the request to the handle and wallet specified in the request. If there is no wallet nickname or wallet address in the request, the receiver's default wallet is selected as the destination.

request.description:
Provisions a new virtual account for the specified user. If a virtual_account_name is specified, this will become the nickname of the new virtual account.

If the user already has a virtual account with the chosen nickname, the new virtual account will be the selected nickname + 8 random characters.

The app you are authenticated on must have already been set up for virtual accounts for this endpoint to succeed.
